  <div id="readme" class="Box-body readme blob instapaper_body js-code-block-container">
    <article class="markdown-body entry-content p-3 p-md-6" itemprop="text"><h1><a id="user-content-es6-promise-subset-of-rsvpjs-" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#es6-promise-subset-of-rsvpjs-"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>ES6-Promise (subset of <a href="https://github.com/tildeio/rsvp.js">rsvp.js</a>) <a href="https://travis-ci.org/stefanpenner/es6-promise" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/34c7b185964985bb1fa123184de293df41178894/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e6f72672f73746566616e70656e6e65722f6573362d70726f6d6973652e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Build Status" data-canonical-src="https://travis-ci.org/stefanpenner/es6-promise.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a></h1>
<p>This is a polyfill of the <a href="http://www.ecma-international.org/ecma-262/6.0/#sec-promise-constructor" rel="nofollow">ES6 Promise</a>. The implementation is a subset of <a href="https://github.com/tildeio/rsvp.js">rsvp.js</a> extracted by @jakearchibald, if you're wanting extra features and more debugging options, check out the <a href="https://github.com/tildeio/rsvp.js">full library</a>.</p>
<p>For API details and how to use promises, see the <a href="http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/es6/promises/" rel="nofollow">JavaScript Promises HTML5Rocks article</a>.</p>
<h2><a id="user-content-downloads" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#downloads"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Downloads</h2>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise/dist/es6-promise.js" rel="nofollow">es6-promise 27.86 KB (7.33 KB gzipped)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise/dist/es6-promise.auto.js" rel="nofollow">es6-promise-auto 27.78 KB (7.3 KB gzipped)</a> - Automatically provides/replaces <code>Promise</code> if missing or broken.</li>
<li><a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise/dist/es6-promise.min.js" rel="nofollow">es6-promise-min 6.17 KB (2.4 KB gzipped)</a></li>
<li><a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise/dist/es6-promise.auto.min.js" rel="nofollow">es6-promise-auto-min 6.19 KB (2.4 KB gzipped)</a> - Minified version of <code>es6-promise-auto</code> above.</li>
</ul>
<h2><a id="user-content-cdn" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#cdn"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>CDN</h2>
<p>To use via a CDN include this in your html:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-text-html-basic"><pre><span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">&lt;!--</span> Automatically provides/replaces `Promise` if missing or broken. <span class="pl-c">--&gt;</span></span>
&lt;<span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-e">src</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise@4/dist/es6-promise.js<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>&gt;&lt;/<span class="pl-ent">script</span>&gt;
&lt;<span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-e">src</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise@4/dist/es6-promise.auto.js<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>&gt;&lt;/<span class="pl-ent">script</span>&gt; 

<span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">&lt;!--</span> Minified version of `es6-promise-auto` below. <span class="pl-c">--&gt;</span></span>
&lt;<span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-e">src</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise@4/dist/es6-promise.min.js<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>&gt;&lt;/<span class="pl-ent">script</span>&gt;
&lt;<span class="pl-ent">script</span> <span class="pl-e">src</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/es6-promise@4/dist/es6-promise.auto.min.js<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>&gt;&lt;/<span class="pl-ent">script</span>&gt; 
</pre></div>
<h2><a id="user-content-nodejs" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#nodejs"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Node.js</h2>
<p>To install:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell"><pre>yarn add es6-promise</pre></div>
<p>or</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-shell"><pre>npm install es6-promise</pre></div>
<p>To use:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-c1">Promise</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">require</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>es6-promise<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>).<span class="pl-smi">Promise</span>;</pre></div>
<h2><a id="user-content-usage-in-ie9" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#usage-in-ie9"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Usage in IE&lt;9</h2>
<p><code>catch</code> and <code>finally</code> are reserved keywords in IE&lt;9, meaning
<code>promise.catch(func)</code> or <code>promise.finally(func)</code> throw a syntax error. To work
around this, you can use a string to access the property as shown in the
following example.</p>
<p>However most minifiers will automatically fix this for you, making the
resulting code safe for old browsers and production:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre>promise[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>catch<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>](<span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">err</span>) {
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">//</span> ...</span>
});</pre></div>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre>promise[<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>finally<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>](<span class="pl-k">function</span>() {
  <span class="pl-c"><span class="pl-c">//</span> ...</span>
});</pre></div>
<h2><a id="user-content-auto-polyfill" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#auto-polyfill"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Auto-polyfill</h2>
<p>To polyfill the global environment (either in Node or in the browser via CommonJS) use the following code snippet:</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-c1">require</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>es6-promise<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>).<span class="pl-en">polyfill</span>();</pre></div>
<p>Alternatively</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-js"><pre><span class="pl-c1">require</span>(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>es6-promise/auto<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>);</pre></div>
<p>Notice that we don't assign the result of <code>polyfill()</code> to any variable. The <code>polyfill()</code> method will patch the global environment (in this case to the <code>Promise</code> name) when called.</p>
<h2><a id="user-content-building--testing" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#building--testing"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Building &amp; Testing</h2>
<p>You will need to have PhantomJS installed globally in order to run the tests.</p>
<p><code>npm install -g phantomjs</code></p>
<ul>
<li><code>npm run build</code> to build</li>
<li><code>npm test</code> to run tests</li>
<li><code>npm start</code> to run a build watcher, and webserver to test</li>
<li><code>npm run test:server</code> for a testem test runner and watching builder</li>
</ul>
</article>
  </div>

    </div>

  

  <details class="details-reset details-overlay details-overlay-dark">
